cli-width

Get stdout window width, with four fallbacks, tty, output.columns, a custom environment variable and then a default.

Usage

npm install --save cli-width

```js ‘use strict’;

var cliWidth = require(‘cli-width’);

cliWidth(); // maybe 204 :) ```

You can also set the CLI_WIDTH environment variable.

If none of the methods are supported, and the environment variable isn’t set, the default width value is going to be 0, that can be changed using the configurable options.

API

cliWidth([options])

cliWidth can be configured using an options parameter, the possible properties are:

  • defaultWidth Defines a default value to be used if none of the methods are available, defaults to 0
  • output
